page.title: 18HILLSTOWN.
page.content: The village of{Hillstown}is made up mainly of Victorian terraced houses built of bricks made in nearby Carr Vale. Over half the population consists of elderly pensioners, the majority of whom were employed in the {farming}industry in the capacity of labourers. Today, those in work are mostly employed in the{mining industry. Hillstown has the following {amenities:-}a methodist chapel, a garden nursery, two shops, a recreation ground, a working mens' club, a post office and a vet's surgery. The land immediately adjacent to Hillstown is fairly flat, being the land behind an{escarpment}and the rich, red soil is cultivated with crops of wheat, barley,potatoes, cabbage and celery.
